reasoning: Essential hypertension: incidence ~120 per 100k per year (new diagnoses), prevalence ~28% of global population (~28,000 per 100k). Chronic condition with both well-documented incidence and prevalence. Primary cause of hypertension (90-95% of cases). Strong epidemiological data from WHO and national surveys.
source: Kearney PM et al. (2005). Global burden of hypertension: analysis of worldwide data. Lancet. 365(9455):217-223
